page.title: 15EDUCATION IN BRAILES
page.content: There has been a school in the village from Tudor times.However,since 1959,older pupils have had to travel to nearby towns for their secondary education. Primary aged children attend Brailes Church of England School, built in 1970 and pleasantly situated in rural surroundings between Upper and Lower Brailes.The majority of the 87 pupils in the school live in the village.A small number are brought in from hamlets and outlying farms within the parish boundaries. During the winter months,evening Adult Education classes are held in this building. Pre_school aged children may attend either the Playschool, held at The Old School,or the Nursery Group at the Methodist Schoolroom.Both meet on three mornings each week.
